meaning: Shortened version of "as hell." Unrelated to early internet slang, "age/sex/location."

Originally meaning "to be yourself and not care about how others view you", the word is now used to indicate an opinion or something that someone agrees with. It is especially common in political slang and discussions and may be used for controversial topics.
To apply makeup to the face. Note that this is also slang in the US Army, meaning "do push-ups."
example: "I'm almost ready for my date night, just have to beat my face real quick."

meaning: Short for "best friend". Sometimes used jokingly with someone one does not have any relationship to.
Yes, okay, "it's on."
example: "You want to get ice cream after school? Bet."

meaning: Used to describe something embarrassing or cringey, particularly in response to an offensive comment.
example: "Wow, when he failed that stunt, that was a big yikes."

meaning: A euphemism for how many people one has had sex with.
example: "I heard her body count was over 20."

meaning: A high-class/materialistic person.
example: "You must live in a castle since you're acting like a boujee."

meaning: Extremely good, excellent. Also used to describe good food.
Swift and witty response to an insult or critique.
example: "He was being mocked, so he clapped back and made the whole room go quiet."

meaning: A dance move used as a gesture of triumph.
Used to describe an ironic internet meme.
Trendy high-class fashion.
A major improvement in one's self, usually an improvement in appearance, confidence, and style. Frequently used in a context relating to puberty.
example: "Their glow-up over the summer was insane."

meaning: Abbreviation for Greatest Of All Time.
Short for "God Damn".
example: "Did you see her latest post? Gyatt!"

meaning: Something that is better in a peculiar manner.
An acronym for the phrase "I just burst out laughing", a version of "lmao".
Used to express shock, embarrassment, and or amusement.
Describe the attitude or connotation of something or someone.
Acronym for "If you know, you know." Used to describe inside jokes.
Give one space to proceed uninterrupted (especially when saying or doing something provocative) in the hope that the result might be entertaining, if not agreeable.
Colloquially: "Enlightened", "Hot", "Fire." The new hotness; something remarkable, interesting, fun or amusing. Generally positive.
Short for "mutuals" or "mutual followers".
example: "I only let my moots reply to my posts."

meaning: To lie. Specifically, saying someone is "capping" or "cap" means to say they are lying. On the other hand, if someone says "no cap", it means they aren't lying.
example:
"I’m actually going to be productive today, no cap."
"You actually got tickets to the Bad Bunny concert? You’re capping."

meaning: Someone who cannot think for themselves and/or has no or little control over their own life, is ready to agree with popular opinion unquestioningly, and always believes what they are told; someone who acts robotic.
example: "He's such an NPC. He has no personality."

meaning: Pejorative directed toward members of the "Baby Boomer" generation, used to dismiss or mock attitudes typically associated with baby boomers as out of date.
example: "You think climate change doesn't exist? OK Boomer."

meaning: Short for opposition or enemies; describes an individual's opponents.
example: "I have to be careful, my opps are over there."

meaning: To be crazy, wild, or extreme, sometimes to an extent which is considered too far.
Used to add emphasis to a subject; placed at the end of a sentence, as with a period. Similar to the British term "full stop".
Used as a conversation stopper when there is nothing left to say
When a reply, particularly on Twitter or TikTok, has better reception and more likes than the original post being replied to.
One's charm/seduction skills
example: "He has all the rizz, he gets every girl"

meaning: To praise someone when they are doing something good. The vowels are often emphasized.
To be shocked, surprised, or bothered.
Sycophancy, being overly affectionate in pursuit of a sexual relationship.
example: "Stop simping for that girl, she doesn't even know you."

meaning: Refers to an ambiguous romantic relationship where all parties have mutual feelings for one another, but said feelings are not clearly defined; a mid-point between dating and not dating.
example: "I don't really know if he likes me or not, so for now it's a situationship."

meaning: Used to convey happiness/laughter.
Used to refer to something that is perceived to be good, particularly used when referring to music.
To do something well.
To imply being in a relationship in a discreet manner on social media. Used when said relationship is not official and could easily be severed.
example: "We're still testing the waters, so right now it's a soft launch."

meaning: Supporting something. Specifically used in cases of overzealous or obsessive support of celebrities.
Short term for suspect/suspicious.
Gossiping (spilling the tea).
To understand what was supposed to be done; to do something well.
example: "When he got up on stage, he understood the assignment."

meaning: To check one's personality or attitude.
To do something so well as to "make one's wig fly off." Unrelated to wig out.
example: "You always wig whenever you write a song."

meaning: To talk too much; To say many words without the words meaning anything
example:
Person 1:"So I just need a Petroleum Tank, and lighter fluid to construct..."
Person 2 "Quit yapping"

meaning: To throw something with force and without regard. Also used as a generic positive exclamation.
example: "He yeeted that pencil across the classroom!"
